info.description:
# Versioning

All API endpoints require the `X-XBOW-API-Version` header to be set to a supported version. Requests without a version header will be rejected with a `400 Bad Request` response.

## Version Lifecycle

API versions follow a `YYYY-MM-DD` naming convention (e.g., `2026-02-01`). Each version is supported for a minimum of 3 months from its release date. We plan to extend this support window as the API matures.

| Version    | Release Date | End of Life |
|------------|--------------|-------------|
| 2026-02-01 | 2026-02-01   | 2026-05-01  |
| next       | Rolling      | N/A         |

## The "next" Version

The `next` version provides early access to upcoming API changes. Use it in non-production environments to test and prepare for the next stable release.

- Changes are pushed to `next` as they stabilize
- `next` becomes the next stable version upon release
- Breaking changes may occur in `next` before a stable release

## End of Life (EOL)

When a version reaches its end-of-life date:

- **API requests** to that version will fail with a `400 Bad Request` response
- **Webhook subscriptions** for that version will stop emitting events

Migrate to a supported version before the EOL date to avoid service disruption.

# Accessing the API

The API is available at `https://console.xbow.com/api/v1/`. All endpoints require authentication via an API key provided in the `Authorization: Bearer <token>` header.

**Note:** The API is not available for Lightspeed.

## Generate an API key

1. Log into your XBOW dashboard at https://console.xbow.com with administrator access to the organization you want to generate an API key for.
1. Click your profile icon in the top right corner and select **Settings**.
1. In the left sidebar, click **Personal Access Tokens**.
1. Click **Generate new token**.
1. Provide a name and select the scope for the token, that is, the organization you want to use it with.
1. Click **Create**.
1. Copy and securely store your key (it won't be shown again).

Store API keys securely using environment variables or secret managers. Never commit keys to version control. Rotate keys periodically and revoke compromised keys immediately.

## API request headers

All API requests require two headers: your API key for authentication and the API version you want to use. For example:

```curl
curl -X GET "https://console.xbow.com/api/v1/assets/{assetId}/findings" \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY" \
  -H "X-XBOW-API-Version: 2026-02-01" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json"
```

## Error responses

In addition to the responses described with each endpoint, the API may also return the following responses:

- `400 Bad Request`: the request was malformed or contained invalid parameters, including missing version header.
- `401 Unauthorized`: missing an API key or the provided API key is invalid
- `403 Forbidden`: the API key is valid, but the user does not have permission to access the requested resource
- `429 Too Many Requests`: exceeded rate limit, try again with exponential backoff
- `500 Internal Server Error`: an unexpected error occurred, try again with exponential backoff

The error response body will be in the following format:

```json
{
  "code": "ERR_ERROR_TYPE",
  "error": "Error Type",
  "message": "Detailed error message"
}
```


# Webhooks

When creating an organization, you may provide an HTTPS webhook URL to receive events related to the organization's resources.

We implement _best-effort_ delivery of events, soon after they occur. We will not retry delivery if it fails for any reason.

## Webhook Versioning

Webhook payloads follow the API version of the subscription. When a version reaches its end-of-life date, webhook subscriptions for that version will stop emitting events. Ensure your integration is updated to a supported version before the EOL date.

## Signature Verification

Each request will be a `POST` request sent with the following headers:
* `X-Signature-Timestamp`: A Unix timestamp in seconds.
* `X-Signature-Ed25519`: An hex string representing an Ed25519 signature of the concatenation of the timestamp and the request body, signed with XBOW's private key.

You must verify the signature using the public key from the `GET /api/v1/meta/webhooks-signing-keys` endpoint.
You must verify that the timestamp is within a valid range from the current time to prevent replay attacks. An example of a valid range might be +/-5 minutes.
You should respond with a 2xx status code if the signature is valid, and a 401 status code otherwise.
Before organization creation, we will send two test `ping` events. One signed with XBOW's private key, and one signed with an invalid key. This allows you to verify that your signature verification is working correctly.

For example, if you're using Node.js:

```javascript
import consumers from "node:stream/consumers";

// Fetch the public key from the API (cache this - it rarely changes)
const keysResponse = await fetch("https://console.xbow.com/api/v1/meta/webhooks-signing-keys", {
  headers: { "X-API-Key": "your-api-key", "X-XBOW-API-Version": "2026-02-01" }
});
const keys = await keysResponse.json();
const publicKeyBase64 = keys[0].publicKey;

// Import the public key (SPKI format, base64-encoded)
const publicKey = await crypto.subtle.importKey(
  "spki",
  Buffer.from(publicKeyBase64, "base64"),
  { name: "Ed25519" },
  false,
  ["verify"],
);

const timestamp = req.headers["x-signature-timestamp"];
const timestampTime = parseInt(timestamp, 10);
const now = Math.floor(Date.now() / 1000);
const isValidTimestamp = (Math.abs(now - timestampTime) < 300);

if (!isValidTimestamp) {
  throw new Error("Invalid timestamp");
}

const signature = req.headers["x-signature-ed25519"];
const body = await consumers.text(req.body);
const isVerified = await crypto.subtle.verify(
  { name: "Ed25519" },
  publicKey,
  Buffer.from(signature, "hex"),
  Buffer.from(timestamp + body),
);

if (!isVerified) {
  throw new Error("Invalid request signature");
}
```


## Webhook Event Payloads
Each request will contain a JSON-encoded body with one of the following payloads:

### `ping`

Used to verify that the webhook URL is reachable and that signature verification works.

```json
{
  "type": "ping"
}
```

### `asset.changed`

Sent when the check state of an asset field changes (e.g. start URL reachable, new DNS boundary rule discovered from crawling).

```json
{
  "type": "asset.changed",
  "asset": { ... } // 200 response from `Get Asset`
}
```

### `assessment.changed`

Sent when the state of an assessment changes (e.g. progress, current step, etc.).

```json
{
  "type": "assessment.changed",
  "assessment": { ... } // 200 response from `Get Assessment`
}
```

### `finding.changed`

Sent when the state of a finding changes (e.g. challenge reviewed).

```json
{
  "type": "finding.changed",
  "finding": { ... } // 200 response from `Get Assessment Finding`
}
```


# Pagination & Rate Limiting

## Pagination

List endpoints use cursor-based pagination. Use the `limit` query parameter to control page size (1-100, default 20) and the `after` parameter to fetch subsequent pages using the cursor from a previous response.

Responses include an `items` array and a `nextCursor` field:

```json
{
  "items": [...],
  "nextCursor": "eyJpZCI6IjEyMyJ9"
}
```

To fetch the next page, pass the `nextCursor` value as the `after` parameter in your next request. When `nextCursor` is `null`, there are no more results.

## Rate Limiting

API requests are subject to rate limiting. If you receive a `429 Too Many Requests` response, implement exponential backoff before retrying.
info.title: XBOW

parameters.description: API version to use for this request
parameters.name: X-XBOW-API-Version

state.description:
Current state of the assessment:

- `waiting-for-capacity`: queued waiting for resources to start assessment
- `running`: assessment released from queue, started and looking for exploits
- `succeeded`: assessment finished running (report has not been generated yet)
- `report-ready`: assessment finished and the report is ready to be downloaded
- `failed`: assessment failed for internal reasons (e.g. infra, extended foundation model outage, etc.)
- `cancelling`: assessment was cancelled by the user before it could complete, teardown in progress
- `cancelled`: assessment was cancelled by the user before it could complete, teardown complete
- `paused`: assessment paused by user
- `waiting-for-time-window`: assessment temporarily paused by XBOW and it will automatically resume as soon as the necessary time window is met

post.description: Cancels a running assessment. If the assessment is already cancelled, this will have no effect.

parameters.description: API version to use for this request
parameters.name: X-XBOW-API-Version

state.description:
Current state of the assessment:

- `waiting-for-capacity`: queued waiting for resources to start assessment
- `running`: assessment released from queue, started and looking for exploits
- `succeeded`: assessment finished running (report has not been generated yet)
- `report-ready`: assessment finished and the report is ready to be downloaded
- `failed`: assessment failed for internal reasons (e.g. infra, extended foundation model outage, etc.)
- `cancelling`: assessment was cancelled by the user before it could complete, teardown in progress
- `cancelled`: assessment was cancelled by the user before it could complete, teardown complete
- `paused`: assessment paused by user
- `waiting-for-time-window`: assessment temporarily paused by XBOW and it will automatically resume as soon as the necessary time window is met

post.description: Pauses a running assessment. If the assessment is already paused, this will have no effect.

post.description: Requests that a paused assessment be resumed. The assessment will be queued, and start as soon as possible. If the assessment is already running, this will have no effect.

get.description: Gets a specific asset by ID.

parameters.description: API version to use for this request
parameters.name: X-XBOW-API-Version

assetReachable.message: Start URL is behind Cloudflare Access

archiveAt.description: When the asset will be (or was) archived

oneOf.description: Timed out whilst trying to reach the URL

put.description:
Updates an existing asset.

Any call to this endpoint will trigger checks on new values which may make requests against the asset. Webhook events will be dispatched as checks complete. Changing `startUrl` or `credentials` will trigger a crawl of the asset to discover new DNS boundary rules.

parameters.description: API version to use for this request
parameters.name: X-XBOW-API-Version

assetReachable.message: Start URL is behind Cloudflare Access

archiveAt.description: When the asset will be (or was) archived

oneOf.description: Timed out whilst trying to reach the URL

get.description:
Lists assessments for an asset.

Supports pagination via `limit` and `after` query parameters.

parameters.description: API version to use for this request
parameters.name: X-XBOW-API-Version

state.description:
Current state of the assessment:

- `waiting-for-capacity`: queued waiting for resources to start assessment
- `running`: assessment released from queue, started and looking for exploits
- `succeeded`: assessment finished running (report has not been generated yet)
- `report-ready`: assessment finished and the report is ready to be downloaded
- `failed`: assessment failed for internal reasons (e.g. infra, extended foundation model outage, etc.)
- `cancelling`: assessment was cancelled by the user before it could complete, teardown in progress
- `cancelled`: assessment was cancelled by the user before it could complete, teardown complete
- `paused`: assessment paused by user
- `waiting-for-time-window`: assessment temporarily paused by XBOW and it will automatically resume as soon as the necessary time window is met

post.description: Queues an assessment on an asset. The assessment will be started as soon as possible. Requires all fields on the asset be defined and checked.

parameters.description: API version to use for this request
parameters.name: X-XBOW-API-Version

attackCredits.description: The number of attack credits to use for this assessment

objective.description: Optional custom objective for the assessment

state.description:
Current state of the assessment:

- `waiting-for-capacity`: queued waiting for resources to start assessment
- `running`: assessment released from queue, started and looking for exploits
- `succeeded`: assessment finished running (report has not been generated yet)
- `report-ready`: assessment finished and the report is ready to be downloaded
- `failed`: assessment failed for internal reasons (e.g. infra, extended foundation model outage, etc.)
- `cancelling`: assessment was cancelled by the user before it could complete, teardown in progress
- `cancelled`: assessment was cancelled by the user before it could complete, teardown complete
- `paused`: assessment paused by user
- `waiting-for-time-window`: assessment temporarily paused by XBOW and it will automatically resume as soon as the necessary time window is met

message.example: Assessment quota exhausted. You may only have one assessment in progress at a time (running, paused, or waiting states).

get.description:
Lists all findings for an asset.

Supports pagination via `limit` and `after` query parameters for API versions after 2025-11-01.

parameters.description: API version to use for this request
parameters.name: X-XBOW-API-Version

severity.description:
Severity level of the finding:

- `critical`: Highest severity, requires immediate attention
- `high`: High severity, should be addressed soon
- `medium`: Medium severity
- `low`: Low severity
- `informational`: Informational only, no immediate action required

state.description:
Current state of the finding:

- `open`: new finding discovered by XBOW
- `challenged`: finding challenged by user
- `confirmed`: finding challenged by user, but confirmed by XBOW as a true positive, cannot be challenged again
- `invalid`: finding challenged by user, and confirmed by XBOW as a false positive, cannot be challenged again
- `fixed`: finding fixed by user

get.description:
Lists all available report versions for an asset.

Supports pagination via `limit` and `after` query parameters.

parameters.description: API version to use for this request
parameters.name: X-XBOW-API-Version

parameters.description: API version to use for this request
parameters.name: X-XBOW-API-Version

example.impact: This finding can lead to X, Y, Z
example.mitigations: To mitigate this, do A, B, C
example.name: Example Finding
example.recipe:
1. First do this
2. Then do this
3. Finally do this

evidence.description: Evidence demonstrating the vulnerability such as a proof-of-concept exploit or request/response logs

impact.description: Markdown description of the impact of the finding

mitigations.description: Markdown description of possible mitigations for the finding

recipe.description: Markdown instructions on how to reproduce the finding

severity.description:
Severity level of the finding:

- `critical`: Highest severity, requires immediate attention
- `high`: High severity, should be addressed soon
- `medium`: Medium severity
- `low`: Low severity
- `informational`: Informational only, no immediate action required

state.description:
Current state of the finding:

- `open`: new finding discovered by XBOW
- `challenged`: finding challenged by user
- `confirmed`: finding challenged by user, but confirmed by XBOW as a true positive, cannot be challenged again
- `invalid`: finding challenged by user, and confirmed by XBOW as a false positive, cannot be challenged again
- `fixed`: finding fixed by user

summary.description: Markdown high-level overview of the finding

post.description: Request verification that a finding has been mitigated. This will trigger a targeted assessment specifically to verify that the vulnerability has been mitigated. Once XBOW verifies that the finding has been fixed, it will be marked as such.

parameters.description: API version to use for this request
parameters.name: X-XBOW-API-Version

state.description:
Current state of the assessment:

- `waiting-for-capacity`: queued waiting for resources to start assessment
- `running`: assessment released from queue, started and looking for exploits
- `succeeded`: assessment finished running (report has not been generated yet)
- `report-ready`: assessment finished and the report is ready to be downloaded
- `failed`: assessment failed for internal reasons (e.g. infra, extended foundation model outage, etc.)
- `cancelling`: assessment was cancelled by the user before it could complete, teardown in progress
- `cancelled`: assessment was cancelled by the user before it could complete, teardown complete
- `paused`: assessment paused by user
- `waiting-for-time-window`: assessment temporarily paused by XBOW and it will automatically resume as soon as the necessary time window is met

message.example: Finding must be in 'open' or 'confirmed' state to verify fix

get.description:
Lists all organizations for an integration.

Requires an _integration_ API key.

Supports pagination via `limit` and `after` query parameters for API versions after 2025-11-01.

parameters.description: API version to use for this request
parameters.name: X-XBOW-API-Version

post.description:
Creates a new organization. This is required before setting up an asset.

Requires an _integration_ API key.

parameters.description: API version to use for this request
parameters.name: X-XBOW-API-Version

externalId.description: External reference for this customer. Must be unique among all organizations you provision.

members.description: List of members in the organization. At least one member is required.

name.description: Name of the company. Not required to be unique.

message.description: An organization has already been created with this external ID

delete.description:
Revokes an existing API key for an organization.

Requires an _integration_ API key.

parameters.description: API version to use for this request
parameters.name: X-XBOW-API-Version

get.description:
Returns the OpenAPI specification in JSON format for the API version specified in the X-XBOW-API-Version header.

Requires an organization API key. This may be made public in the future.

parameters.description: API version to use for this request
parameters.name: X-XBOW-API-Version

get.description:
Returns the public keys used to sign webhook requests. Use these keys to verify webhook signatures.

The array supports key rotation - during rotation, multiple keys may be active.

parameters.description: API version to use for this request
parameters.name: X-XBOW-API-Version

publicKey.description: Base64-encoded Ed25519 public key in SPKI format

get.description:
Retrieves a specific organization by ID.

Accepts either an _integration_ API key or an _organization_ API key.

parameters.description: API version to use for this request
parameters.name: X-XBOW-API-Version

put.description:
Updates an existing organization.

Requires an _integration_ API key.

parameters.description: API version to use for this request
parameters.name: X-XBOW-API-Version

get.description:
Lists all assets in an organization.

Supports pagination via `limit` and `after` query parameters.

parameters.description: API version to use for this request
parameters.name: X-XBOW-API-Version

post.description: Creates a new asset in an organization. An asset represents a web application to be assessed. They contain boundaries, credentials, etc.

parameters.description: API version to use for this request
parameters.name: X-XBOW-API-Version

archiveAt.description: When the asset will be (or was) archived

oneOf.description: Timed out whilst trying to reach the URL

post.description:
Creates a new API key for an organization in an integration. 

Requires an _integration_ API key.

parameters.description: API version to use for this request
parameters.name: X-XBOW-API-Version

expiresInDays.description: Number of days until the key expires. If not specified, defaults to 30 days. Maximum 365 days.

get.description:
Lists all webhook subscriptions for an organization.

Supports pagination via `limit` and `after` query parameters.

Requires an _organization_ API key.

parameters.description: API version to use for this request
parameters.name: X-XBOW-API-Version

post.description:
Creates a new webhook subscription for an organization.

Requires an _organization_ API key.

parameters.description: API version to use for this request
parameters.name: X-XBOW-API-Version

get.description: Downloads a report version as a PDF file using its UUID.

parameters.description: API version to use for this request
parameters.name: X-XBOW-API-Version

get.description: Gets a summary of a report version using its UUID.

parameters.description: API version to use for this request
parameters.name: X-XBOW-API-Version

schema.description: Markdown summary of the report, suitable for display in the UI

200.description: Markdown summary of the report, suitable for display in the UI

delete.description:
Deletes a webhook subscription.

Requires an _organization_ API key.

parameters.description: API version to use for this request
parameters.name: X-XBOW-API-Version

get.description:
Gets a specific webhook subscription by ID.

Requires an _organization_ API key.

parameters.description: API version to use for this request
parameters.name: X-XBOW-API-Version

patch.description:
Updates an existing webhook subscription.

Requires an _organization_ API key.

parameters.description: API version to use for this request
parameters.name: X-XBOW-API-Version

get.description:
Lists delivery history for a specific webhook subscription.

Supports pagination via `limit` and `after` query parameters.

Requires an _organization_ API key.

parameters.description: API version to use for this request
parameters.name: X-XBOW-API-Version

payload.description: The webhook event payload that was delivered. Structure varies by event type and API version used to send the webhook.

body.description: Up to 1000 bytes of response body

post.description:
Sends a ping event to a webhook subscription to test connectivity.

Requires an _organization_ API key.

parameters.description: API version to use for this request
parameters.name: X-XBOW-API-Version

message.example: Webhook responded with non-2xx status code

tags.description:
Endpoints related to assessments for assets.

All endpoints require an _organization_ API key.
tags.name: Assessments

tags.description:
Endpoints related to assets within an organization.

All endpoints require an _organization_ API key.
tags.name: Assets

tags.description:
Endpoints for viewing and managing findings.

All endpoints require an _organization_ API key.
tags.name: Findings

tags.description: Endpoints related to organizations and their management.
tags.name: Organizations

tags.description:
Endpoints for downloading and viewing reports.

All endpoints require an _organization_ API key.
tags.name: Reports

tags.description:
Endpoints for managing webhook subscriptions.

All endpoints require an _organization_ API key.
tags.name: Webhooks
